data.title: Halloween Palm Springs 2023 to Feature The Pussycat Dolls' Carmit, Queen of Electro Luciana and David Hernandez
data.meta_description: The much anticipated Halloween Palm Springs will be returning to the Arenas District in Palm Springs Sunday, October 29 with the annual T-Dance from 4:00-6:00PM and LIVE PERFORMANCES from 6:00-10:00p.m. Carmit Bachar – artist, performer, television personality, and philanthropist – is best known as the only original member of the multi-platinum and Grammy-nominated recording group […]
data.text:
The much anticipated Halloween Palm Springs will be returning to the Arenas District in Palm Springs Sunday, October 29 with the annual T-Dance from 4:00-6:00PM and LIVE PERFORMANCES from 6:00-10:00p.m.

Carmit Bachar – artist, performer, television personality, and philanthropist – is best known as the only original member of the multi-platinum and Grammy-nominated recording group The Pussycat Dolls. As one of the three main vocalists in the burlesque-inspired girl group, this distinctive red-haired beauty with the sultry voice rose to international fame as an overnight pop sensation with The Pussycat Dolls’ chart-topping hit singles including “Don’t Cha,” “Buttons,” and “StickWitU.” Their debut album PCD (2005) sold almost 7 million albums and spawned a phenomenon that dominated the teen market and beyond, including PCD clothing, the interactive PCD Music Lounge, and The Pussycat Dolls Lounge in Las Vegas at Caesar’s Palace. As a founding member of the original Pussycat Dolls cabaret show, which began in Los Angeles’ famed clubs The Viper Room and The Roxy, Carmit performed as a singer and dancer alongside many guest stars including: Carmen Electra, Charlize Theron, Paris Hilton, Christina Aguilera, Nikka Costa, Pamela Anderson, and Gwen Stefani. Carmit graced the covers of Maxim Magazine, Interview Magazine, and Blender Magazine. She also appeared with the original group in numerous film and TV projects including Charlie’s Angels: Full Throttle, Jimmy Kimmel Live, The Tonight Show with Jay Leno, The Late Show with David Letterman, and Last Call with Carson Daly.

‘Queen of Electro,’ Luciana has stood at the forefront of the electro nu-wave movement with a supercharged sound that has infiltrated dance floors across the globe particularly in the United States where she has had 8 Billboard Dance No.1s.

She has been the voice behind countless club anthems and collaborated with the biggest names in EDM including Tiesto, Hardwell, KHSMR, Will Sparks, Fedde Le Grande, Bassjackers, and Moguai to name a few.

Luciana’s collaboration with South American megastar Juan Magan went #1 in 9 countries on the first day of release and went platinum within two weeks.

The video rocketed to over 70 million YouTube views in less than four months.

She has also written songs for many other artists including Britney Spears, Kylie Minogue and Havana Brown.

David Hernandez is a true self-made artist who gained national attention as a Top 12 finalist on American Idol. With his dynamic voice and affable personality, he has captured the hearts of his adoring fans. His talents have been showcased on notable platforms like The Today Show, MTV’s TRL, and TV Guides’ Sexiest Stars, among others. David’s ability to reinvent himself and sustain in an ever-changing industry while maintaining his edge and drive sets him apart.

Beyond his American Idol success, David’s achievements include performing at the Inaugural Kick-Off Celebration ball for Barack Obama with John Legend and Maroon 5.

He has toured the world, captivating audiences with his soulful powerhouse vocals while writing and producing his original music.

One of David’s notable hits, “Beautiful,” made its way to the Top 100 of the Billboard Dance charts, with its music video becoming a viral sensation. In the past year, he has released self-produced songs and music videos like “Sorry,” “Kingdom,” and the infectious summer anthem “Boomerang.”

We will keep the dance party going all night with avant-garde band Jesika Von Rabbit, A Cabbello along with DJ Galaxy, and DJ Mod Girl spinning to keep the dance party going. Join the men of Cybersocket.com, Alexander Rodriguez of “On the Rocks” fame and Palm Springs own ambassador Bella da Ball as your Master of Ceremonies and many more surprises to be announced soon!

The ever-so-popular Halloween Palm Springs Tito’s Handmade Vodka VIP Lounge is back and better than ever, with a hosted bar including Tito’s Vodka, Stella Artois, Michelob Ultra, Nutrl Hard Seltzer, Jagermeister and more with in/out privileges and dedicated port-a-potties (don’t laugh, you will thank us)! Tickets are only $75.00 at www.HalloweenPalmSprings.com.

A Hocker Productions Event, Halloween Palm Springs is FREE with a suggestion donation of $10 being accepted at each of the entrances benefiting DAP Health, Palm Springs Gay Men’s Chorus, Greater Palm Springs Pride and LGBTQ+ Community Center of the Desert.

“This year will be the most high energy show we’ve had to date, showcasing the hottest female talent. We continue to support Palm Springs based LGBTQ+ non-profit organizations as we are passionate about giving back to the community we love,” Jeff Hocker, Executive Producer, Halloween Palm Springs.

Registration for the Costume Contest begins at 6:30 p.m at the Information booth on Arenas Road and will end promptly at 7:45 p.m. Registered participants must be in line with their wristband at the main stage no later that 8:00 p.m.
